revised_title: The Role of Islets of Langerhans in the Pancreas
tldr: This study investigates the histological changes in the pancreas caused by the secretion of secretin, revealing significant differences in the structures known as the 'islets of Langerhans.' The author discusses various theories about the nature and function of these structures and concludes that they are groups of alveolar cells altered by fatigue, which can be reconverted into alveoli during rest.
